page.title: 01EPPERSTONE AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: Epperstone is a picturesque village situated in a conservation area 7 miles north_east of Nottingham.Large mature trees lining the main street,in the churchyard and in gardens,are a striking feature of the village. Property is very expensive,making it difficult for young people born here to remain in the village.Some large houses provide service employment for villagers.Much interest is taken in the cultivation of gardens and all the available allotments are in use.The wish to conserve and to resist change is very strong amongst the villagers as a whole. Epperstone attracts many visitors, particularly to the"Cross Keys Inn", and to walk the public footpaths.The local residents also enjoy these amenities and feel privileged to live in such pleasant place.
